content.webTitle: Andy Murray among players drafted for International Premier Tennis League

fields.headline: Andy Murray among players drafted for International Premier Tennis League
fields.bodyText: Andy Murray is among the "icon" players in Sunday's draft for the new International Premier Tennis League, to be played in Asia at the end of the year. The draft in Dubai also includes Novak Djokovic, Rafael Nadal, Serena Williams and Victoria Azarenka, plus Pete Sampras and Andre Agassi among those in the "legends" category. The IPTL, running from 28 November to 20 December, features teams based in Hong Kong, Mumbai, Singapore, Bangkok and Kuala Lumpur playing home and away. Each match comprises five sets in a different format – men's singles, women's singles, men's doubles, mixed doubles and men's legends. The IPTL was set up by the former doubles specialist Mahesh Bhupathi.
